title: Flags `--interactive` and `--progress` do not play nicely with each other
body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

N/A, I am able to work around this issue by simply not using both `--interactive` and `--progress` flags at the same time.

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I just recently started using `rclone sync` command. As mentioned by the [docs](https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_sync/) I tried using the `--interactive` and `--progress` flags. All behavior is working as expected; the issue is the output is...hard to read. (The "last" progress display works properly and still updates in place correctly.):

```
$ rclone sync --progress --interactive dropbox:/Books ./Books
Transferred:              0 B / 0 B, -, 0 B/s, ETA -
Checks:              3234 / 3234, 100%
Elapsed time:         7.1srclone: copy "Games/RPGs/D&D 5th Edition/Character Sheets/Pregen Characters 1-10/HumanPaladin1-10/Human Paladin 1.pdf"?
y) Yes, this is OK (default)
n) No, skip this
s) Skip all copy operations with no more questions
Transferred:              0 B / 4.029 MiB, 0%, 0 B/s, ETA -
Checks:              4423 / 4423, 100%
Transferred:            0 / 30, 0%
Elapsed time:        11.1s
Transferring:
 * Games/RPGs/D&D 5th Edi‚Ä¶10/Human Paladin 1.pdf: transferring
 * Games/RPGs/D&D 5th Edi‚Ä¶0/Human Paladin 10.pdf: transferring
 * Games/RPGs/D&D 5th Edi‚Ä¶10/Human Paladin 2.pdf: transferring
 * Games/RPGs/D&D 5th Edi‚Ä¶10/Human Paladin 3.pdf: transferring^C
```
_NOTE: The final `^C` is me manually stopping `rclone`

Further, the prompt is still responsive, e.g. hitting enter to trigger the default "Yes" answer gives me:


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.61.1
- os/version: darwin 13.1 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 22.2.0 (arm64)
- os/type: darwin
- os/arch: arm64
- go/version: go1.19.4
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Mac OS X Ventura 13.1 (on Apple M1 Max)
```shell
$ uname -a
Darwin pbohan-<REDACTED> 22.2.0 Darwin Kernel Version 22.2.0: Fri Nov 11 02:03:51 PST 2022; root:xnu-8792.61.2~4/RELEASE_ARM64_T6000 arm64
```

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Dropbox

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```shell
$ rclone sync --progress --interactive dropbox:/Books ./Books
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

N/A, as the behavior is working as expected, only the UI experiences an issue. (If there is more data in the logs that I am unaware of please let me know and I will re-run with the `-vv` flag and post the output.)
